verses.verse: My soul <S%H5315><s%> is weary <S%H5354><s%> of my life; <S%H2416><s%> I will leave <S%H5800><s%> my complaint <S%H7879><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> myself; I will speak <S%H1696><s%> in the bitterness <S%H4751><s%> of my soul. <S%H5315><s%>

I will say <S%H559><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> God, <S%H433><s%> Do not <S%H408><s%> condemn <S%H7561><s%> me; show <S%H3045><s%> me wherefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H4100><s%> thou contendest <S%H7378><s%> with me.

Is it good <S%H2896><s%> unto thee that <S%H3588><s%> thou shouldest oppress, <S%H6231><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> thou shouldest despise <S%H3988><s%> the work <S%H3018><s%> of thine hands, <S%H3709><s%> and shine <S%H3313><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> the counsel <S%H6098><s%> of the wicked? <S%H7563><s%>
Hast thou eyes <S%H5869><s%> of flesh? <S%H1320><s%> or <S%H518><s%> seest <S%H7200><s%> thou as man <S%H582><s%> seeth? <S%H7200><s%>
Are thy days <S%H3117><s%> as the days <S%H3117><s%> of man? <S%H582><s%> are thy years <S%H8141><s%> as man's <S%H1397><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%>
That <S%H3588><s%> thou inquirest <S%H1245><s%> after mine iniquity, <S%H5771><s%> and searchest <S%H1875><s%> after my sin? <S%H2403><s%>
Thou knowest <S%H1847><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> I am not <S%H3808><s%> wicked; <S%H7561><s%> and there is none <S%H369><s%> that can deliver <S%H5337><s%> out of thine hand. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3027><s%>
Thine hands <S%H3027><s%> have made <S%H6087><s%> me and fashioned <S%H6213><s%> me together <S%H3162><s%> round about; <S%H5439><s%> yet thou dost destroy <S%H1104><s%> me.

Remember, <S%H2142><s%> I beseech thee, <S%H4994><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> thou hast made <S%H6213><s%> me as the clay; <S%H2563><s%> and wilt thou bring me into dust again? <S%H7725><s%> <S%H413><s%> <S%H6083><s%>
Hast thou not <S%H3808><s%> poured me out <S%H5413><s%> as milk, <S%H2461><s%> and curdled <S%H7087><s%> me like cheese? <S%H1385><s%>
Thou hast clothed <S%H3847><s%> me with skin <S%H5785><s%> and flesh, <S%H1320><s%> and hast fenced <S%H7753><s%> me with bones <S%H6106><s%> and sinews. <S%H1517><s%>
Thou hast granted <S%H6213><s%> <S%H5978><s%> me life <S%H2416><s%> and favor, <S%H2617><s%> and thy visitation <S%H6486><s%> hath preserved <S%H8104><s%> my spirit. <S%H7307><s%>
And these <S%H428><s%> things hast thou hid <S%H6845><s%> in thine heart: <S%H3824><s%> I know <S%H3045><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> this <S%H2063><s%> is with <S%H5973><s%> thee.
If <S%H518><s%> I sin, <S%H2398><s%> then thou markest <S%H8104><s%> me, and thou wilt not <S%H3808><s%> acquit <S%H5352><s%> me from mine iniquity. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5771><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> I be wicked, <S%H7561><s%> woe <S%H480><s%> unto me; and if I be righteous, <S%H6663><s%> yet will I not <S%H3808><s%> lift up <S%H5375><s%> my head. <S%H7218><s%> I am full <S%H7649><s%> of confusion; <S%H7036><s%> therefore see <S%H7200><s%> thou mine affliction; <S%H6040><s%>
For it increaseth. <S%H1342><s%> Thou huntest <S%H6679><s%> me as a fierce lion: <S%H7826><s%> and again <S%H7725><s%> thou showest thyself marvelous <S%H6381><s%> upon me.

Thou renewest <S%H2318><s%> thy witnesses <S%H5707><s%> against <S%H5048><s%> me, and increasest <S%H7235><s%> thine indignation <S%H3708><s%> upon <S%H5973><s%> me; changes <S%H2487><s%> and war <S%H6635><s%> are against <S%H5973><s%> me.

Wherefore <S%H4100><s%> then hast thou brought me forth <S%H3318><s%> out of the womb? <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7358><s%> Oh that I had given up the ghost, <S%H1478><s%> and no <S%H3808><s%> eye <S%H5869><s%> had seen <S%H7200><s%> me!

I should have been <S%H1961><s%> as though <S%H834><s%> I had not <S%H3808><s%> been; <S%H1961><s%> I should have been carried <S%H2986><s%> from the womb <S%H4480><s%> <S%H990><s%> to the grave. <S%H6913><s%>
Are not <S%H3808><s%> my days <S%H3117><s%> few? <S%H4592><s%> cease <S%H2308><s%> then, and let me alone, <S%H7896><s%> <S%H4480><s%> that I may take comfort <S%H1082><s%> a little, <S%H4592><s%>

Before <S%H2962><s%> I go <S%H1980><s%> whence I shall not <S%H3808><s%> return, <S%H7725><s%> even to <S%H413><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> of darkness <S%H2822><s%> and the shadow of death; <S%H6757><s%>

A land <S%H776><s%> of darkness, <S%H5890><s%> as <S%H3644><s%> darkness <S%H652><s%> itself; and of the shadow of death, <S%H6757><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> any order, <S%H5468><s%> and where the light <S%H3313><s%> is as <S%H3644><s%> darkness. <S%H652><s%>
